definition: neighbors/next-door neighbors/related work units/colleagues doing related work

sentences.english: Don't talk so loud — you'll wake the whole street.
sentences.chinese: 別那麼大聲說話，你快把左鄰右舍都吵醒了。

sentences.english: All his neighbours felt sorry for this and came to console him.
sentences.chinese: 左鄰右舍也因此爲他感到難過，紛紛來塞翁家安慰他。

sentences.english: There are quite a few foreigners in my neighborhood.
sentences.chinese: 我的左鄰右舍有相當多的外國人。

sentences.english: Because this man was rich, many people in his neighborhood knew him.
sentences.chinese: 由於他很闊，左鄰右舍都認識他。

sentences.english: On the day she moved to the new house, the neighbors came to help her.
sentences.chinese: 搬到新家那一天，左鄰右舍都前來幫忙。

sentences.english: Nuclear fallout or no nuclear fallout, their neighbors will need them.
sentences.chinese: 無論有沒有核輻射，他們的左鄰右舍都需要他們。

sentences.english: Neighbors Doukua him, listening to heart the old Winn also flattered.
sentences.chinese: 左鄰右舍都誇他，老溫聽了心裏也美滋滋的。

sentences.english: Don't talk so loudly or you'll wake the whole street.
sentences.chinese: 別那麼大聲說話，你快把左鄰右舍都吵醒了。

sentences.english: She's very ill-disposed towards her neighbours.
sentences.chinese: 她對左鄰右舍概無好感。

definition: to run this way and that (idiom); to rush about busily/to bustle about
you can net sparrows at the door (idiom); completely deserted
to talk endlessly/talking of anything under the sun
drinking party/to go on a binge/to paint the town red
to send (sb) away/to change the subject/to open (an umbrella etc)
smile spread across the face (idiom); beaming with pleasure/all smiles/joy written across one's face
to enquire solicitously about sb's well-being (idiom)/to pamper
